name: Extended Address
description: The XAN data type is used to represent comprehensive address information with enhanced geographic and administrative components beyond standard address formats. It provides detailed address structure including geographic codes, administrative regions, and address validation elements essential for international healthcare operations. XAN enables precise location identification, postal automation, emergency response coordination, and compliance with international addressing standards in global healthcare environments.

XAN.1.name: Street Address
XAN.1.description: The detailed street address information including street number, name, and dwelling designations. Provides the primary physical address components for location identification.

XAN.2.name: Other Designation
XAN.2.description: Additional address designation such as care of, attention to, or special delivery instructions. Provides supplementary address routing information.

XAN.3.name: City
XAN.3.description: The city or municipality name for the address. Essential component for mail delivery and geographic identification.

XAN.4.name: State or Province
XAN.4.description: The state, province, or primary administrative subdivision. Critical for addressing in countries with federal or regional administrative structures.

XAN.5.name: Zip or Postal Code
XAN.5.description: The postal or ZIP code for mail sorting and delivery. Essential for postal automation and precise location identification.

XAN.6.name: Country
XAN.6.description: The country code or name for international address identification. Critical for global healthcare operations and international mail delivery.

XAN.7.name: Address Type
XAN.7.description: The classification of address type (e.g., home, business, mailing, temporary). Specifies the intended use and characteristics of the address.

XAN.8.name: Other Geographic Designation
XAN.8.description: Additional geographic identifiers such as county, district, or region. Provides supplementary geographic context for precise location identification.

constraints.addressType: Address type should reference valid values from table 0190
constraints.countryCode: Country should reference valid codes from table 0399
constraints.postalValidation: Postal codes should follow country-specific formatting rules
constraints.geographicConsistency: Geographic components should be logically consistent and valid
